page.title: 02ARABLE FARMING IN SAMPFORD
page.content: Most of the farming is arable farming.A large amount of cereal crops are grown,together with various break crops.The land in our area is very suitable for wheat growing.Farms produce top quality wheat to be used for flour and baking purposes.Also a lesser quality wheat is grown for making biscuits and for animal feed.Barley grows well as a secondary crop.Our farm land produces top quality barley for malting for beermaking.Lesser quality barley grows for animal feed shults.Several farms grow many acres of peas.Bolt is for human and animal consumption.Black- eyed beans are grown as a break crop.These are sold for animal feed or exported to countries like Egypt where they are used for flour production.
